description: Liouville's function: parity of number of primes dividing n (with multiplicity).
references: J. Roberts, Lure of the Integers, Math. Assoc. America, 1992, p. 279.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
H. Gupta, On a table of values of L(n), Proceedings of the Indian Academy of Sciences. Section A, 12 (1940), 407-409. [Annotated scanned copy]
R. S. Lehman, On Liouville's function, Math. Comp., 14 (1960), 311-320.
formula: a(n) = ((-1)^bigomega(n)+3)/2, where bigomega(n) is the number of prime divisors of the integer n counted with multiplicity.a(n) = 2 - A001222(n) mod 2. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 10 2011
mathematica: a[1] = 2; a[n_] := ((-1)^Total[FactorInteger[n][[All, 2]]] + 3)/2; (* or, from version 7 on : *) a[n_] := Boole[ EvenQ[ PrimeOmega[n]]] + 1; (* or *) a[n_] := (LiouvilleLambda[n] + 3)/2; a[1] = 2; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 105}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Apr 08 2013, updated Jan 27 2015 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
